intro: Rondeletia pachyphylla subsp. pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved rondeletia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
